QUOTE: Thanks to the considerable pressure we orchestrated from Congress and the Administration, BLM Director Fry and USFS Chief Dombeck have backed away... The agencies were clearly surprised by the clout we wielded, and are now more than willing to negotiate.
CONTEXT: This quote, from a forwarded internal memo, is a direct admission of leveraging political power to force federal regulatory agencies to retract unfavorable policies.

QUOTE: Larcamp told Hartsoe and I after the meeting that FERC may clarify that the price caps and reporting obligations apply only to bids into the PX and ISO -- ie no bilateral transaction will be subject to the requirements.
CONTEXT: The sender is relaying potentially improper, off-the-record guidance from a federal regulator (FERC staffer Larcamp) about a loophole to evade impending price caps.

QUOTE: We understand that the Commission intends to punish, by whatever means it has available, those entities that object and exercise their rights to challenge the subpoenas.
CONTEXT: This quote from a draft legal letter to the CPUC acknowledges a deliberate strategy of withholding information from regulators and anticipates punitive retaliation for doing so.

QUOTE: It is not even clear what the grounds are for overturning the award, which indicates that it may be pure politics. Do we have any good political consultants that could help us in Grand Rapids?
CONTEXT: This forwarded request shows an intent to use political influence to overturn the legitimate outcome of a public contract bid that an Enron subsidiary lost.

QUOTE: I think we should let people in the legislature know about this and see if one or more of them can get their hands on it.
CONTEXT: The sender suggests leaking information from a lawsuit—where a plaintiff's own expert allegedly found no evidence of wrongdoing—to legislators to politically undermine opponents.
